FuncDef:
The c-bsr interval command sets the interval at which the bootstrap router (BSR) sends bootstrap messages.
The undo c-bsr interval command restores the default setting. The c-bsr interval command sets the interval at which the bootstrap router (BSR) sends bootstrap messages. The undo c-bsr interval command restores the default setting. By default, the interval at which the BSR sends bootstrap messages is 60 seconds. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: IPv6 PIM view,VPN instance IPv6 PIM view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interval at which the C-BSR sends bootstrap messages.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 107374177, in seconds.
